chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Wesley Lee Arneson was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today.

Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination; No objection to EMP.
**Stipulated Sentence Credit is to be 212 Days **
Concurrent with: with all other sentences currently serving.
DL revocation with any administrative credit.
Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation.
AODA (unless already completed) and follow up.

records.addlTxt: Stipulation and Order Regarding Sentence Credit /s/ SMC 09/26/22
Stipulation and Order Regarding Sentence Credit filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner (sent to Judge Corbett on 09/26/22 sp)

9:28 am State appears by ADA Kelly Cassidy via Zoom video.
Defendant appears in custody from the Wood County Jail via Zoom video, Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears via Zoom video.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. 
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to:
COUNT 2: Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 yrs (3rd) >> DIMISSED OUTRIGHT.
COUNT 3: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.
---
PLEA to: 
COUNT 1: OWI (3rd w/Passenger < 16 yrs old) >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

BY THE COURT:
$2,500.00 fine inclusive; 
90 days jail with Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination; No objection to EMP.  
Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 48 months. 
48 months DL revocation with any administrative credit. 
AODA (unless already completed) and follow up. 
DNA sample and surcharge. 6 points.  Concurrent with all other sentences currently serving. 

COURT grants counsel 10 days to provide stipulation for jail credit.  

Adjourned: 9:52 a.m.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Emailed DA and Assistant as to status of case. az
filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

No written waiver had been filed.
Defendant knows what his rights are after speaking with his attorney.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

3:05 PM Defendant Wesley Lee Arneson appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.   Attorney Maxwell Bergner for Wesley Lee Arneson appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin, ADA Robert Jambois, appeared in court. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.
Follow all open bond conditions.
10 days for counsel to have this bond signed and returned to the clerk of courts office.

02:33 PM Defendant Wesley Lee Arneson appeared by video from the Wood County Jail.   Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appeared in peson. Defendant Wesley Lee Arneson in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Defendant has not yet received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Atty Bergner would ask that this be set for both an initial appearance/preliminary hearing.

State recommends that the bond in 21CF146 be amended to include this case with conditions as stated on the record.
Court will make it easy and set a separate bond with a nominal amount and with the conditions as stated on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court would set a nominal cash bond in the amount of $50 with conditions as stated on the record.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
